quest.name: Sylph-management
journal: Minfilia needs you to investigate the sylphs.

Minfilia would have you ascertain the sylph tribe's intentions, aided by the power of the Echo. Before making contact with the diminutive beastmen, report to Commander Vorsaile Heuloix at the Adders' Nest in Gridania.
You arrive at the Adders' Nest to find the commander thinking out loud. Apprise him as to the purpose of your visit.
objectives: Speak with Vorsaile Heuloix at the Adders' Nest.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Now, having set aside the formalities...

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: ...We have a favor to ask of you.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Urianger. Have the documents arrived from the Students of Baldesion?

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Aye, my lady, they arrived but recently.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: We have conducted a study at the behest of the Order of the Twin Adder.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Papalymo, Yda─a synopsis, if you would.

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: Our task was to survey the behavior of the sylphs, a beast tribe indigenous to the Twelveswood.

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: Oh, how to describe them... They look like...gysahl greens? Floating ones! That worship the primal Ramuh.

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: Ahem. Though technically a “beast tribe,” sylphs are blessed with a comparatively personable demeanor, conducive to peaceful communication.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Offering us an invaluable opportunity to learn what the beast tribes know of the primals.

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: While Ramuh's existence is well documented, the sylphs do not─or perhaps, can not─summon the primal any longer, insofar as can be ascertained. Until such time as we know...

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: ...It would be unwise to assume that the threat posed by the primal has passed.

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: Which leaves Gridania with the added worry of not knowing what they should be worrying about!

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: In that regard, they are hardly alone. What we can say with absolute certainty is that Gridania has its hands full fending off Garuda.

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: Who, I need hardly remind you, is among the most savage and terrible of all known primals.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: In short, it is essential that we approach the sylphs in as diplomatic a manner as possible.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Words and actions can be misconstrued. The only sure way to communicate our intentions is the Echo.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Winning the sylphs' favor may well bring us a step closer to mitigating the threat of the primals. Will you help us?

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: I am grateful.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Lovely! Well, as much as I'd like to help, I'm afraid I would be of little use to anyone in Gridania. A veritable babe in the woods.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Yda and Papalymo, however, should be able to see the forest for the trees. Is that not so, Minfilia?

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Indeed. You are willing?

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: Leave it to me!

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: Us, Yda. Us!

dialogue.name: VORSAILE
dialogue.text: We know far too little of the sylphs to lay any worthwhile plans. We must call upon the Scions once more if we are to─

dialogue.name: VORSAILE
dialogue.text: Ah, beg pardons. 'Tis a terrible habit of mine to think aloud. But tell me, what brings you to the Adders' Nest?

obj.n: Peasants by Day, Ninjas by Night
Pride and Duty (Will Take You from the Mountain)
A Song of Bards and Bowmen
